full_summary:
# Advance Procurement Notice - Multi-Mission Aircraft Maintenance Hangar

## Solicitation Details

*   **Solicitation Number:** GW24CMMA_81654
*   **Solicitation Title:** Canadian Multi-Mission Aircraft Maintenance Hangar
*   **Description:** This Advance Procurement Notice is for a potential Contract for Multi-Mission Aircraft Maintenance Hangar in support of the Canadian Multi-Mission Aircraft Program.

## Contract Description

The Canadian Multi-Mission Aircraft Program will acquire long-range patrol aircraft to replace the existing CP-140 Aurora fleet. The new aircraft will be based at Canadian Forces Base 14 Wing Greenwood, Nova Scotia, and Canadian Forces Base 19 Wing Comox, British Columbia. The program will include new infrastructure and renovations to existing infrastructure to support the new aircraft at both bases.

The Advance Procurement Notice is for the following potential contract:

*   A Modified-Design Build (MDB) project for construction and design of a new 6-bay aircraft maintenance hangar at Canadian Forces Base 14 Wing Greenwood. The contract worth approximately $428 million is expected to include construction and design of a 6-bay hangar for Royal Canadian Air Force aircraft, which will feature ultra-large bay operations for precision aircraft testing, advanced avionics test stations, cryogenic fluid storage, and more.

It is anticipated that the solicitation for this contract will be released in Spring/Summer 2024, pending approval from the Department of National Defence (DND).

## Security Clearance

To be eligible for contract award, a consultant or contractor must actively hold all required security clearance(s) at the time of closing, as specified in the solicitation. The required security clearance(s) are a Valid and Active Facility Security Clearance (FSC) at the level of SECRET granted or approved by the Contract Security Program (CSP) of Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC).

## Sponsorship for Security Clearance

DCC is providing consultants and contractors with early access to the security clearance application process through sponsorship under its Industrial Security Program (ISP). Interested consultants and contractors are encouraged to apply for sponsorship to begin the security clearance application process. The sponsor process is outlined at https://www.dcc-cdc.gc.ca/industry/security-requirements. The applicant must provide a Contract number, 81654, and the requested Security Clearance Level.
